documents.document: @RuralDoc_Emma thanks Em! Still flying for a while, just moving states.

This is unbelievable. I doubt very much the denial came from Nauruan govt given their own women are flown out https://t.co/NjY3Ma2hyn
Guessing he hasn't heard of Pine Gap either. It's kind of a secret anyway right?
Right now, I'm actually kind of glad #DonaldTrump doesn't seem to realise how close Australia is to South China Sea.
@ralanshirley and as a combined GP/EM trainee, GP skills very useful in hospital.
@ralanshirley I think this would stop a lot of "GP to chase", and stone walling of GP referrals by hosp registrars. Increases safety for pts
@ralanshirley every pt sees GP at some stage. Imp for hosp docs to know how world outside hosp works & what GPs can practically do for pts

The landline is a lifeline in the bush. Rare to get an emergency call on a mobile out here.

@nomadicgp @EMS_Junkie @mina_el_naguib have seen ripper brawl over bouquet, also one girl left alone in middle cos all knew meant for her

@EDEnchanted do it! But yes advise finish training first. Vintage plus exams at same time (always at same time!) = very bad.
@EDEnchanted yes!! This feeling led me to move to Tasmania, buy a farm, start a vineyard and start making wine. Best decision ever!
@MDamphetaminh @ketaminh ha ha. Note did not tweet this whilst actually in back of said ambulance, it was a few days ago and am still livid.
Whatever you are doing on the road, it is NEVER more important than an ambulance running lights and sirens. PULL OVER & get out of the way!
@BenZabar but was successful. Got v nervous when gastro arrived, announced too unstable to go to theatre, so would scope & pull tube in ICU
@BenZabar we call it a Sengstaken, have only seen it used once
@poped01 @docfromthebush @KangarooBeach v frustrating to get "GP to chase" but hosp won't release results bc GP didn't order/not copied in

#thatsbias Many places I've worked had no sterile gloves my size, only large (man hand) sizes. Lady doctors do procedures too @feminemtweets

@Dr_Polarbird yep. I looked a bit like that. Explanation was have to wait for update from UK due to licence. UK updated >18 months ago.
When I was an intern I was scared of intubation bc I worried I wouldn't get the tube in. Had no idea of RSI drugs/risks.
Probably more concerning focus on intubation even for juniors w/o discussing dangers of RSI. "Fixing" "A" before looking at "C" = disaster
Interesting these things went out in UK APLS course > 12 months ago https://t.co/1YP3R37b71
At APLS learning such pearls as hard collars in all inc head injured pts, and 2 x 20ml/kg crystalloid bolus in hypotensive trauma
I'm going to have a pre night shift snooze and hope when I wake up I'll find this was all a bad dream, and it's only Monday.
@ketaminh @jeffayton Goondiwindi & St George last 2 EDP in Qld both closed last few years due to local availability blood products/retrieval

@EBMgoneWILD @ketaminh @aLittleMedic @Cannulator rural Aus towns have known large panel, screened reg. Multiple donors called in for trauma
@ketaminh fantastic local resource. My hometown stopped last year now have stored blood avail & chopper in vicinity: https://t.co/ns5R9tpzjz
@ketaminh ah will see how turns out then. Problem is if I give blood I tend to faint ðŸ˜³
